oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band (KVOO) - 1947-09-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: KVOO, Tulsa, OK radio program of Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band, including Jimmy Hall (fiddle, vocals) and Bill Edwards (vocals). Originally broadcast 1947-09-12 at 11:30 am (CST). Performed live at the Pla-mor Ballroom in Tulsa, OK, with announcer Johnny Ryan.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Leon McAuliffe; Western Swing Band (Leon McAuliffe)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Station announcement -- Opening statement (Johnny Ryan) -- Opening theme (Steel Guitar Rag) -- Johnny Ryan introduces Leon McAuliffe -- Kill 'Um (Jimmy Hall fiddle, Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Johnny Ryan reads listener requests -- You Can't Break The Chains Of Love (Jimmy Hall vocals, Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Johnny Ryan announces the band's tour schedule -- A Plain Talking Man From The West (Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Johnny Ryan reads listener requests -- Naughty Angeline (Bill Edwards vocals, Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Johnny Ryan talks -- Little Girl, Go Ask Your Mama (Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Closing statement (Johnny Ryan) -- Closing theme (Smooth Sailing) -- Station announcement -- Pepsi jingle (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: KVOO (Radio station : Tulsa, Okla.); McAuliffe, Leon, 1917-1988; Western Swing Band (Musical group : Leon McAuliffe); Ryan, Johnny (Announcer); Hall, Jimmy, 1921-; Edwards, Bill (Musician)
